name: ASAP Rocky
description:
'''Rakim Athelston Mayers''' (born October 3, 1988), known professionally as '''ASAP Rocky''' ({{IPAc-en|ˈ|eɪ|s|æ|p}} {{respell|AY|sap}}; stylized as '''A$AP Rocky'''), is an American rapper, record producer, actor, fashion designer and model. Born and raised in [[Harlem]], he embarked on his musical career as a member of the [[hip hop music|hip hop]] collective [[ASAP Mob]], from which he adopted his [[stage name]]. In August 2011, Mayers' single "[[Peso (song)|Peso]]" was [[music leak|leaked online]] and began receiving radio airplay within weeks, propelling [[cloud rap]] into mainstream attention. He signed with [[Polo Grounds Music]], an imprint of [[RCA Records]], that October and released his debut mixtape, ''[[Live. Love. ASAP|Live. Love. A$AP]]'' to widespread critical acclaim.

Mayers' 2012 single, "[[Fuckin' Problems]]" (featuring [[Drake (musician)|Drake]], [[2 Chainz]] and [[Kendrick Lamar]]), marked his first entry—at number eight—on the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]], was nominated for [[Grammy Award for Best Rap Song|Best Rap Song]] at the [[56th Annual Grammy Awards]], and preceded his debut studio album, ''[[Long. Live. ASAP|Long. Live. A$AP]]'' (2013). A critical and commercial success, it debuted atop the [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]] and received [[RIAA certification|double platinum]] certification by the [[Recording Industry Association of America]] (RIAA). His second album, ''[[At. Long. Last. ASAP|At. Long. Last. A$AP]]'' (2015), also debuted atop the chart and saw continued critical praise; its two lead singles, "[[Lord Pretty Flacko Jodye 2 (LPFJ2)]]" and "[[Everyday (ASAP Rocky song)|Everyday]]" (featuring [[Rod Stewart]], [[Miguel (singer)|Miguel]] and [[Mark Ronson]]), both received double platinum certifications by the RIAA, while its third, "[[LSD (song)|L$D]]", was nominated for [[Grammy Award for Best Music Video|Best Music Video]] at the [[58th Annual Grammy Awards]]. His third album, ''[[Testing (album)|Testing]]'' (2018), debuted within the ''Billboard'' 200's top five, while his fourth album, ''[[Don't Be Dumb]]'' (2026), debuted atop the chart. 

Aside from his musical career, Mayers founded the creative agency and record label [[AWGE Label|AWGE]] in 2014. AWGE launched partnerships with [[Marine Serre]], [[Amina Muaddi]], [[Moncler]], [[JW Anderson]], [[Under Armour]], [[PacSun]], [[Vans]], [[Mercedes-Benz]], [[Selfridges]], as well as conceptual collaborations with [[MTV]] and Needles. Mayers co-launched cult fashion label ''VLONE'', co-chaired the [[Met Gala]] in 2025 and spearheaded campaigns for [[DKNY]], [[Calvin Klein (fashion house)|Calvin Klein]], [[Gucci]], [[Bottega Veneta]], [[Salvatore Ferragamo (company)|Ferragamo]], [[Beats by Dre]], [[Dior Homme]] and more. As of 2025, he serves as the creative director for [[Puma (brand)|Puma]] F1 and [[Ray-Ban]]. As an actor, Mayers has had supporting roles in ''[[Dope (2015 film)|Dope]]'' (2015), ''[[Monster (2018 film)|Monster]]'' (2018), [[Spike Lee]]'s ''[[Highest 2 Lowest]]'' (2025) alongside [[Denzel Washington]], and ''[[If I Had Legs I'd Kick You]]'' (2025).

Mayers has received accolades such as a [[BET Awards|BET Award]], two [[BET Hip Hop Awards]], an [[MTV Video Music Awards Japan|MTV Video Music Award Japan]] and an [[MTVU#MTVU Woodie Awards|MTVU Woodie Award]]. His creative entrepreneurship has been rewarded with the [[Style Icon Asia|Global Style Icon Award]], the [[Virgil Abloh]] award, the [[The Fashion Awards|Cultural Innovator Award]], the [[Footwear News|Collaboration Of The Year Award]], and the [[CFDA Fashion Awards|Fashion Icon Award]]. He has been nominated for two [[Grammy Award]]s, six [[World Music Awards]], three [[MTV Video Music Award]]s and two [[MTV Europe Music Award]]s. Furthermore, Mayers has co-directed most of his own [[Music video director|music videos]], as well as worked in [[hip hop production|production]] or co-writing for other artists, often under the pseudonym Lord Flacko.
